result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell S Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment, psych sexual assessment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
May not have contact with CMD and MD, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell S Olson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Terminated - Regular  kmk

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Issue of oustanding court costs.  Court enters civil judgment for outstanding court costs.
Probation review hearing on January 20, 2017 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty German acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Statements from:  C.D., M.D.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge, bond applied.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty J German appeared by phone, on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court received e-mail from State requesting to adjourn trial due to a medical issue with one witness and as another witness whose location is unknown.  ADA Delgado states the lead investigator is out of State and her location is unknown, they are attempting to locate her.  Atty German does not oppose request to adjourn.  Court grants adjournment of trial from 2/5/16 at 1pm; the JT of 2/8/16 at 8:30am is changed to a STC.  Bond continued.
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  JS is reset to 2/5/16 at 1pm.  Bond continued.
Deft's motions in limine; filed by Atty J German.
Deft's requested jury instructions.
of appearance; Atty J German for deft.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 1/21/16 at 1:15pm and JS 2/8/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial at 10-30-2015 10:30 am

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 10/9/15 at 11am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

1:53 pm    Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.    Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Clerk:  NJ.  Plea of not guilty entered by the Court.  PTC 7-24-15 @ 1:45 & FPT 8-4-15 @ 8:45.  $250 cash bond set with conditions.-
$250 posted on 6-7-15
